Class Player

java.lang.Object
players.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Person, Warrior, Wizard
public abstract class Player extends Object implements Serializable
This Player class is responsible for implementing base functionality for all player types.
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • baseHealth

      private double baseHealth
      Current health.

    • basicAttack

      private double basicAttack
      Strength of basic attack.

    • spellAttack

      private double spellAttack
      Strength of spell attack.

    • inventory

      private Map<TreasureType,Treasure> inventory
      Inventory, containing treasures, enhancing player statistics. The player can hold only one treasure instance of each treasure type. The key represents the treasure type. The value are the treasure instances.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(int basicAttack, int spellAttack)
      Sets a base constructor for the player types. The Player class is abstract, so it cannot create instances.
      Parameters:
      basicAttack - Basic attack stat
      spellAttack - Spell attack stat

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentHealth

      public double getCurrentHealth()
      Gets current health.
      Returns:
      Current health

    • getBasicAttack

      public double getBasicAttack()
      Gets basic attack. If the player has a weapon, the basic attack is buffed.
      Returns:
      Basic attack

    • getSpellAttack

      public double getSpellAttack()
      Gets spell attack. If the spell has a weapon, the spell attack is buffed.
      Returns:
      Spell attack

    • pickUpItem

      public void pickUpItem(Treasure treasure)
      Picks up new treasure and replaces the old treasure in the inventory.
      Parameters:
      treasure - The new treasure, that will be put in the inventory

    • getTreasureItem

      public Treasure getTreasureItem(TreasureType type)
      Gets the treasure of the given treasure type.
      Parameters:
      type - The treasure type, that is searched for in the inventory
      Returns:
      Instance of the treasure, found in the inventory

    • updateBasicAttack

      public void updateBasicAttack(int additionalBasicAttack)
      Adds points in the basic attack stat.
      Parameters:
      additionalBasicAttack - Additional points, that are going to be added to basic attack stat

    • updateSpellAttack

      public void updateSpellAttack(int additionalSpellAttack)
      Adds points in the spell attack stat.
      Parameters:
      additionalSpellAttack - Additional points, that are going to be added to spell attack stat

    • removeHealth

      public void removeHealth(int dealtDamage)
      Removes health from the health stat. If armour is present, the dealt damage is lowered.
      Parameters:
      dealtDamage - Damage, that is going to be subtracted from the base health of the player

    • updateHealth

      public void updateHealth(double additionalHealth)
      Adds points in the health stat.
      Parameters:
      additionalHealth - Additional points, that are going to be added to health stat

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Gets string representation of the player stats and treasure.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String representation of the player stats and treasure
